title.narrative: Niger Community Action Project for Climate Resilience

description.narrative: The project development objective (PDO) is to improve the resilience of the populations and of production systems to climate changeand variability in targeted Communes.

participating-org.narrative: Ministry of Planning - Project Coordination Unit
Ministry of Planning, Local Government and Community Development

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Section 4.01(a) and 4.02 | Description :The execution and delivery of the Grant and Loan Agreements on behalf ofthe Recipient have been dulyauthorized or ratified by allnecessary governmental action | Due Date :08-May-2012

Finance Agreement :Section 4.01(a) | Description :The Recipient has established the Technical Coordination Committee. | Due Date:08-May-2012

Finance Agreement :Section IV.B.1 (b) | Description :Prior to disb. offunds of Category(5) for financing ofsubcomponent2.2(b)(ii): (A) the Recipient has: (AA) adopted the Social Safety Net Implementation Manual; (BB) established agrievancemechanism; and (CC) entered into a Matching Grant Agreement with a Targeted Commune; and (B) saidTargeted Commune hascompleted the targeting of the Eligible Beneficiaries entitled to a Cash Transfer. | Due Date :01-May-2013

Finance Agreement :Section IV.B.1 (c) | Description :Prior to disb. offunds of Category(6) for subcomponent2.2(b)(ii): (A) theRecipient has: (AA) adopted the Social Safety Net Implementation Manual: (BB) established a grievancemechanism; and (CC) enteredinto a Matching Grant Agreement with a Targeted Commune;and (B) saidTargeted Commune has: (AA) completed the targeting andrecruitment of Eligible workers; and (BB) if required entered into a | Due Date :01-May-2013

title.narrative: Number of targeted community facilities that have been protected, restored or rehabilitated
Forage yield increase in the project's areas of intervention
Additional silvo pastoral areas with improved SLM
Quantity of animal food supplements produced by the projet
Number of LDPs and AIPs incorporating climate resilience
Crop yield increase in the project's areas of intervention
Additional agricultural areas with improved SLM
Number of climate resilience knowledge products disseminated
Percentage of producers adopting SLM practices introduced by the project
Number of households benefiting from accumulated ASP activities (desegregated by gender)
Number of sector policies which fully incorporate climate resilience
Integrated services platforms known as “Maisons du Paysan” established and operational
Share of small-holder female farmers within 20 km of a Maisons du Paysan that have improved access to agricultural services
Existence of channels and/or institutionalized mechanisms allowing citizens to engage in actions on resilience to climate change through government agencies and other stakeholders
